trial_identification.studytitle: Evaluating pre-operative carbohydrate supplementation in hip fracture patients - A feasibility study for a randomised control trial
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Is a randomised control trial to evaluate the impact of pre-operative carbohydrate supplementation on patient outcomes feasible in acute hip fracture patients admitted to The Prince Charles Hospital Hip Fracture Unit?

interventions.interventions: Evaluating the provision of pre-operative carbohydrate drinks in the acute hip fracture setting: A feasibility study for a randomised control trial Intervention: Carbohydrate supplement (0.5kcal/ml, clear fluid liquid; 50.4g carbohydrate (maltodextrin) per 400mL serve.) 400mL carbohydrate supplement to be consumed orally within 1hour, 2-3 hours before surgery. Single dosage only and consumption recorded by the administrating staff member.
interventions.comparator:
Control arm will consist of standard peri-operative care - patients fasting from mid night.
pre, intra and post operative standardised care pathways align with the Australian and New Zealand Guideline for Hip Fracture Care - Improving Outcomes in Hip Fracture management of Adults guideline

primaryOutcome.outcome: Integration success of the intervention into routine clinical practice (success of feasbility study for standard care use; composite outcome) Review of medication charts to determine correctly prescribed and administered supplements (measured by script) Review of OT schedule and changes to OT schedule as a result of supplement consumption (measured by mins delayed)
Adherence with prescribed carbohydrate supplement. Documented by administering staff member

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Patient perceived quality of life using the EQ-5D tool
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: DAY 2 post operative and at 10 week fracture clinic

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Unfavorable outcomes - incidence of aspiration (documented in medical notes)
Hospital Length of Stay - review of medical notes
Supplement intolerance and subsequent nausea/vomiting- review of consumption + antiemetic use + episodes of vomiting collected from medical chart/medication list

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: - fractured neck of femur - community dwelling prior to admission
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: - non operative managment - diabetes requiring insulin - oral feeding aversion or carbohydrate intolerance - admission for supported accomodation including nursing home and residential aged care facilities

trial_design.statisticalmethods: 32 participants will be required to determine feasibility descriptive statistics will be presented for all variables. Univariable associations between control and intervention groups analysed by Chi square as well as thematic analysis for non-consent, consumption or delivery concerns

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This feasibility trial will evaluate the provision of pre-operative carbohydrate drinks in the acute hip fracture setting to inform feasible and clinically relevant reserach protocol to enable a larger efficacy study to answer the research question.
